text: The black-flanked tree frog (Boana nigra) is a frog that lives in Ecuador. Scientists have seen it between 910 and 1847 meters above sea level. The adult male frog measures 38.5 to 46.3 mm from nose to rear end and the adult female frog 56.4 to 76.7 mm. This frog is brown, reddish brown, or darn brown on the back with darker spots. It has black sides and black stripes. The webs on its feet are either black or bright orange. This frog's English and scientific names come from the Latin word for "black." ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Black-flanked tree frog
